Warfare.description: Training in weapons, tactics, and battlefield skill. Governs combat proficiency with firearms, melee weapons, and heavy equipment.

Firearms.description: Skilled handling of pistols, rifles, carbines, and SMGs.
effects: +1 die when attacking with pistols, revolvers, rifles, or SMGs.
No penalty for using two-handed firearms in tight spaces.

HeavyWeapons.description: Training in machine guns, launchers, and experimental weapons.
effects: +1 die when using MGs, launchers, or mounted weapons.
Can identify a weapon's caliber and ammo type on sight.

CloseCombat.description: Expertise in knives, batons, fists, and improvised tools.
effects: +1 die in melee combat.
When armed with a knife or improvised weapon, escalate damage 1 step on a critical.

Tactics.description: Understanding battlefield positioning, cover, and coordinated maneuvers.
effects: Once per scene, let 1 ally reposition before initiative is rolled.
Allies gain +1 die to their first action when you issue a command.

Lore.description: Knowledge of history, cultures, languages, religions, cryptids, and the occult.

Occult.description: Understanding supernatural symbols, magic, demons, angels, and rituals.
effects: +1 die when identifying supernatural threats.
Once per session, declare you 'recognize this ritual' to learn one GM hint.

History.description: Academic or practical understanding of historical events, artifacts, and politics.
effects: +1 die to checks involving old documents, ruins, or political groups.
Recognize authentic relics vs. forgeries.

Cryptids.description: Specialized knowledge of monsters, folklore, and creature behaviors.
effects: +1 die to track, hunt, or evade nonhuman creatures.
Once per session, identify a monster's weakness.

Linguistics.description: Understanding of multiple languages or ability to decipher text.
effects: +1 die to translate or decode inscriptions.
Can communicate simple ideas across language barriers.

Medicine.description: Training in field medicine, surgery, first aid, and trauma response.
effects: +1 die to stabilize bleeding characters.
With proper tools, downgrade one Moderate Wound to Light during downtime.

Thievery.description: Covers infiltration, mechanical bypassing, sleight of hand, and burglary.

Lockpicking.description: Opening doors, safes, chests, and mechanical locks.
effects: +1 die to pick locks.
Pick simple locks instantly outside of combat.

Pickpocketing.description: Subtle theft, lifting keys, wallets, or items unnoticed.
effects: +1 die to steal without being seen.
Once per scene, retroactively declare you lifted a small object.

Mechanics.description: Understanding mechanical traps, devices, and simple machines.
effects: +1 die to disarm traps or sabotage devices.
Can identify mechanical weaknesses on sight.
+1 die to lying, bluffing, or impersonation.
Create a believable false identity with preparation.
+1 die when threatening or forcing compliance.
Interrogations take half the usual time.

Occult.description: Active magical practice â€” rituals, runes, sigils, charms.
effects: +1 die to cast or perform rituals.
Once per session, safely disrupt a minor supernatural effect.

Entertainment.description: Performance, charm, acting, music, and presence.
effects: +1 die when performing or distracting a crowd.
Gain small favors from impressed audiences.

Demolitions.description: Handling explosives, charges, and structural damage.
effects: +1 die when placing or defusing explosives.
Once per session, identify a structure's weak point.

Mechanics.description: Fixing vehicles, engines, generators, or machinery.
effects: +1 die to repair checks.
During downtime, restore a broken item to working order.
+1 die to reroute or bypass electrical systems.
Can build crude transmitters/receivers with scavenged parts.
+1 die to hide or move silently.
Difficult terrain does not impose stealth penalties.

Tracking.description: Following footprints, trails, scents, and environmental clues.
effects: +1 die to follow or evade a target.
Once per session, ask the GM one question about what the target did last.
